$schema.description: JSON Schema reference for editor support

project_id.description: A string used to distinguish different Supabase projects on the same host. Defaults to the working directory name when running `supabase init`.

workflow_profile.description: Workflow profile that determines how commands behave. Options: 'solo' (direct to prod), 'staged' (staging -> prod), 'preview' (manual preview envs), 'preview-git' (git-driven preview envs). Defaults to 'solo'.

schema_management.description: How database schema changes are managed. 'declarative': describe desired state, system calculates diff. 'migrations': traditional versioned migration files. Defaults to 'declarative'.

config_source.description: Where config is managed. 'code': config.json is source of truth, pushed to remote. 'remote': dashboard is source of truth, pulled to local. Defaults to 'code'.

port.description: Port to the local Logflare service.

vector_port.description: Port to the local syslog ingest service.

backend.description:
Configure one of the supported backends:

- `postgres`
- `bigquery`

port.description: Port to use for the API URL.

items.description: Schemas to expose in your API. Tables, views and functions in this schema will get API endpoints. `public` and `storage` are always included.
Extra schemas to add to the search_path of every request. public is always included.

max_rows.description: The maximum number of rows returned from a view, table, or stored procedure. Limits payload size for accidental or malicious requests.

enabled.description: Enable TLS for the local PostgREST service.

external_url.description: External URL for accessing the API server.

site_url.description: The base URL of your website. Used as an allow-list for redirects and for constructing URLs used in emails.

additional_redirect_urls.description: A list of _exact_ URLs that auth providers are permitted to redirect to post authentication.

items.description: A URL that auth providers are permitted to redirect to.

jwt_expiry.description: How long tokens are valid for, in seconds. Defaults to 3600 (1 hour), maximum 604,800 seconds (one week).

enable_refresh_token_rotation.description: If disabled, the refresh token will never expire.

refresh_token_reuse_interval.description: Allows refresh tokens to be reused after expiry, up to the specified interval in seconds. Requires enable_refresh_token_rotation = true.

enable_manual_linking.description: Allow/disallow testing manual linking of accounts.

enable_signup.description: Allow/disallow new user signups to your project.

enable_anonymous_sign_ins.description: Allow/disallow anonymous sign-ins to your project.

uri.description: The URI of the postgres function or HTTP endpoint to call.

secrets.description: The secrets to pass to the postgres function or HTTP endpoint.

items.description: A secret to pass to the function or endpoint.

uri.description: The URI of the postgres function or HTTP endpoint to call.

secrets.description: The secrets to pass to the postgres function or HTTP endpoint.

items.description: A secret to pass to the function or endpoint.

enabled.description: Enable/disable the custom access token hook.

uri.description: The URI of the postgres function or HTTP endpoint to call.

secrets.description: The secrets to pass to the postgres function or HTTP endpoint.

items.description: A secret to pass to the function or endpoint.

uri.description: The URI of the postgres function or HTTP endpoint to call.

secrets.description: The secrets to pass to the postgres function or HTTP endpoint.

items.description: A secret to pass to the function or endpoint.

uri.description: The URI of the postgres function or HTTP endpoint to call.

secrets.description: The secrets to pass to the postgres function or HTTP endpoint.

items.description: A secret to pass to the function or endpoint.

otp_length.description: The length of the OTP code.

template.description: The template to use for the phone message.

max_frequency.description: The maximum frequency of the phone messages.

max_enrolled_factors.description: The maximum number of MFA factors a user can enroll in.

timebox.description: The timebox for the user session.

inactivity_timeout.description: The inactivity timeout for the user session.

enable_signup.description: Allow/disallow new user signups via email to your project.

double_confirm_changes.description: If enabled, a user will be required to confirm any email change on both the old, and new email addresses. If disabled, only the new email is required to confirm.

enable_confirmations.description: If enabled, users need to confirm their email address before signing in.

secure_password_change.description: If enabled, users will need to reauthenticate or have logged in recently to change their password.

max_frequency.description: Controls the minimum amount of time that must pass before sending another signup confirmation or password reset email.

host.description: Hostname or IP address of the SMTP server.

port.description: Port number of the SMTP server.

user.description: Username for authenticating with the SMTP server.

pass.description: Password for authenticating with the SMTP server.

admin_email.description: Email used as the sender for emails sent from the application.

sender_name.description: Display name used as the sender for emails sent from the application.

subject.description: The subject of the invite email.

content_path.description: The path to the content of the invite email.

subject.description: The subject of the confirmation email.

content_path.description: The path to the content of the confirmation email.

subject.description: The subject of the recovery email.

content_path.description: The path to the content of the recovery email.

subject.description: The subject of the magic link email.

content_path.description: The path to the content of the magic link email.

subject.description: The subject of the email change email.

content_path.description: The path to the content of the email change email.

enable_signup.description: Allow/disallow new user signups via SMS to your project.

enable_confirmations.description: If enabled, users need to confirm their phone number before signing in.

template.description: The template to use for the SMS message.

max_frequency.description: Controls the minimum amount of time that must pass before sending another sms otp.

enabled.description: Enable/disable Twilio provider for phone login.

account_sid.description: The account SID for the Twilio API.

message_service_sid.description: The message service SID for the Twilio API.

auth_token.description: The auth token for the Twilio API.

enabled.description: Enable/disable Twilio Verify provider for phone verification.

account_sid.description: The account SID for the Twilio API.

message_service_sid.description: The message service SID for the Twilio API.

auth_token.description: The auth token for the Twilio API.

enabled.description: Enable/disable MessageBird provider for phone login.

originator.description: The originator of the SMS message.

api_key.description: The API key for the MessageBird API.

enabled.description: Enable/disable Textlocal provider for phone login.

sender.description: The sender of the SMS message.

api_key.description: The API key for the Textlocal API.

enabled.description: Enable/disable Vonage provider for phone login.

from.description: The sender of the SMS message.

api_key.description: The API key for the Vonage API.

api_secret.description: The API secret for the Vonage API.

test_otp.description: Use pre-defined map of phone number to OTP for testing.

client_id.description: Client ID for the Apple OAuth provider.

secret.description:
Client secret for the Apple OAuth provider.

DO NOT commit your OAuth provider secret to git. Use environment variable substitution instead.

url.description: The base URL used for constructing the URLs to request authorization and access tokens.

redirect_uri.description: The URI the Apple OAuth2 provider will redirect to with the code and state values.

skip_nonce_check.description: If true, the nonce check will be skipped.

port.description: Port to use for the local database URL.

shadow_port.description: Port to use for the local shadow database.

major_version.description: The database major version to use. This has to be the same as your remote database's. Run `SHOW server_version;` on the remote database to check.

port.description: Port to use for the local connection pooler.

pool_mode.description: Specifies when a server connection can be reused by other clients. Configure one of the supported pooler modes: `transaction`, `session`.

default_pool_size.description: How many server connections to allow per user/database pair.

max_client_conn.description: Maximum number of client connections allowed.

enabled.description: Enable seeding the database with SQL files.

sql_paths.description: Paths to SQL files to seed the database with. Supports glob patterns relative to supabase directory.

items.description: Path to a SQL file to seed the database with.

enabled.description: Enable the local Edge Runtime service.

policy.description: Configure the supported request policy. Use `oneshot` for hot reload, or `per_worker` for load testing.

inspector_port.description: Port to run the Edge Functions inspector on.

enabled.description:
Controls whether a function is deployed or served. When set to false,
the function will be skipped during deployment and won't be served locally.
This is useful for disabling demo functions or temporarily disabling a function
without removing its code.

verify_jwt.description:
By default, when you deploy your Edge Functions or serve them locally, it
will reject requests without a valid JWT in the Authorization header.
Setting this configuration changes the default behavior.

import_map.description:
Specify the Deno import map file to use for the Function.

Note that the `--import-map` flag overrides this configuration.

entrypoint.description:
Specify the entrypoint path to the Function (defaults to "functions/slug/index.ts").

Both `.js` and `.ts` file extensions are supported.

port.description:
Port to use for the email testing server web interface.

Emails sent with the local dev setup are not actually sent - rather, they are monitored, and you can view the emails that would have been sent from the web interface.

smtp_port.description:
Port to use for the email testing server SMTP port.

Emails sent with the local dev setup are not actually sent - rather, they are monitored, and you can view the emails that would have been sent from the web interface.

If set, you can access the SMTP server from this port.

pop3_port.description:
Port to use for the email testing server POP3 port.

Emails sent with the local dev setup are not actually sent - rather, they are monitored, and you can view the emails that would have been sent from the web interface.

If set, you can access the POP3 server from this port.

ip_version.description: Bind realtime via either IPv4 or IPv6.

max_header_length.description: Maximum length of the HTTP header.

public.description: Enable public access to the bucket.

file_size_limit.description: The maximum file size allowed for the bucket.

allowed_mime_types.description: The list of allowed MIME types for the bucket.

items.description: A MIME type allowed for the bucket.

objects_path.description: The path to the objects in the bucket.

enabled.description: Enable the local Supabase Studio dashboard.

port.description: Port to use for Supabase Studio.

api_url.description: External URL of the API server that frontend connects to.

openai_api_key.description: OpenAI API key to use for Supabase AI in the Supabase Studio.

orioledb_version.description: Postgres storage engine to use OrioleDB (S3)
